mfm.widgets package¶

Submodules¶

mfm.widgets.configuration_editor module¶

This example demonstrates the use of pyqtgraph’s parametertree system. This provides a simple way to generate user interfaces that control sets of parameters. The example demonstrates a variety of different parameter types (int, float, list, etc.) as well as some customized parameter types

mfm.widgets.widgets.clear_layout(layout)[source]¶

Used to clear all widgets in a layout :param layout: :return:

mfm.widgets.widgets.get_directory(**kwargs)[source]¶

Opens a new window where you can choose a directory. The current working path is updated to this directory.

It either returns the directory or the files within the directory (if get_files is True). The returned files can be filtered for the filename ending using the kwarg filename_ending.

Returns:directory str
mfm.widgets.widgets.get_fortune(fortunepath='./mfm/ui/fortune/', min_length=0, max_length=100, attempts=1000, **kwargs)[source]¶
mfm.widgets.widgets.hide_items_in_layout(layout)[source]¶

This function hides all items within a Qt-layout

Parameters:layout – Qt-Layout
mfm.widgets.widgets.open_file(description='', file_type='All files (*.*)', working_path=None)[source]¶

Open a file within a working path. If no path is specified the last path is used. After using this function the current working path of the running program (ChiSurf) is updated according to the folder of the opened file.

Parameters:
  • working_path –
  • description –
  • file_type –
Returns:

Open a file within a working path. If no path is specified the last path is used. After using this function the current working path of the running program (ChiSurf) is updated according to the folder of the opened file.

mfm.widgets.widgets.save_file(description='', file_type='All files (*.*)', working_path=None)[source]¶

Same as open see above a file within a working path. If no path is specified the last path is used. After using this function the current working path of the running program (ChiSurf) is updated according to the folder of the opened file.
